title: Strictly Come Dancing bosses caught 'recycling dresses' from two years ago

Show bosses of Strictly Come Dancing are reportedly recycling dresses from 2017 as Amy Dowden was spotted in a similar outfit to Alexandra Burke's two series ago.

Eagle-eyed fans noticed the recycled outfit when Amy danced with celebrity partner Karim Zeroual on Saturday.

The sparkly silver tasselled dress she wore at the weekend appeared to be a slightly modified version of the dress that Alexandra pulled off when she participated on the show.

Burkes' dress featured thicker straps but it is virtually identical to the style Amy wore on the dancefloor.

The Bad Boys hit maker wore the dress as she danced the jive with Gorka Marquez to Proud Mary - and it earned the pair the first 10s of the series.

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

(Image: Supplied by WENN)

But the Strictly costume team are well-known for designing custom-made garments for the stars to wear on live shows.

Each dancer and their celebrity partner don an individually designed outfit when they step into the spotlight.

X Factor winner Alexandra was a finalist in 2017's show and scored the most 10s in history of the dance show.

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

It comes after David James has become the fourth celebrity to leave Strictly Come Dancing 2019.

The former footballer and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova were sent home in a unanimous decision by the judges.

After discovering his fate, David gave a heartfelt message to fellow celeb Will Bayley, who reduced half the judges and most of the audiences to tears with his moving routine.

(Image: PA)

The pair found themselves at the bottom of the leaderboard after failing to impress with their Jive to 'Such a Night' by Michael Bublé on Saturday night.

They lost out to BBC Breakfast star Mike Bushell and his partner Katya Jones, who gave a stronger performance in the dreaded dance-off.
description: Fans of the hit Saturday night show have spotted an outfit repeat on Amy Dowden
